section.heading: General.
section.text: This chapter prescribes the policies, procedures, and authorizations for allocating the Catalytic Revitalization Project Tax Credit described in this chapter.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated and as defined in the Act.
Terms Defined.
“Act” means the Housing and Community Development Article, Title 6, Subtitle 9, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Affordable” means housing costs do not exceed 30 percent of a household's annual income.
“Catalytic revitalization project” means the substantial rehabilitation of a property in the State:
That was formerly owned by the State or the federal government;
In which rehabilitation will foster economic, housing, and community development within the community in which the property is located; and
That is out of service and was formerly used as a college or university, K–12 school, hospital, mental health facility, or military facility or installation.
“Costs” means the costs incurred to develop a catalytic revitalization project and includes the costs of:
Necessary studies, surveys, plans, and specifications;
Architectural, engineering, or other special services, including flood plain studies, environmental audits, and critical area or wetland assessments;
Land and improvements;
Site preparation;
Construction and rehabilitation, as applicable;
Indemnity and surety bonds and premiums on insurance;
Temporary relocation expenses of residents, if applicable; and
Other costs determined to be acceptable by the Department.
“Department” means the Department of Housing and Community Development.
“New construction costs” means the costs associated with the construction of new structures that connect, expand, or integrate the existing structures to be rehabilitated.
“Owned” means a prior ownership interest in real property pursuant to a:
Deed;
Long-term lease;
Federal or State law or legal authority that allowed use and occupation of real property for a governmental purpose; or
Other legal instrument.
“Rehabilitation costs” means the costs associated with the rehabilitation of existing structures.
“Secretary” means the Secretary of Housing and Community Development.
“State tax credit” means the Catalytic Revitalization Project Tax Credit allowed under the Act and this chapter.
An individual, nonprofit organization, or business entity that is proposing a catalytic revitalization project may apply to the Department for an allocation of the available State tax credit.
An applicant shall be in good standing and qualified to do business in Maryland.
An applicant shall have the legal authority to execute an enforceable agreement with the Department.
The Department may accept applications on a first-come, first-served basis or in competitive rounds to be announced by the Department when the State tax credit is available under the Act.
The Department shall consider the following factors when reviewing an application with an emphasis on applications that promote affordable housing:
Historic preservation;
Community development; and
Economic development.
An application submitted to the Department shall:
Be on standard application forms prescribed by the Department;
Be submitted by an eligible applicant under Regulation .03 of this chapter;
Be for a catalytic revitalization project;
Provide a description of how the project will promote the factors listed in §B of this regulation;
Describe if the project will be completed in phases; and
Include any other information required by the Department.

Applications shall be accompanied by all documentation in the form and containing the information specified by the application procedures adopted by the Department, which may vary depending on the type of project.
Application Evaluation.
Each application submitted shall be reviewed by the Department to determine whether all of the information required under this chapter is contained in the application.

Upon submission of all required information, the Department shall undertake an analysis of each application and make a recommendation to the Secretary as to whether a project is eligible for an initial allocation of the State tax credit and any special terms and conditions for a project
The Department shall identify if a project will be in phases and eligible for multiple final tax credit certificates.
Approval of Applications.
If the Department recommends approval of a project for an initial State tax credit allocation, the Department shall present the project to the Secretary.
The Secretary shall approve, disapprove, or approve with modifications an initial State tax credit allocation to be provided according to procedures established by the Secretary.

The Secretary, in the sole discretion of the Secretary, may delegate to an authorized officer of the Department the authority to approve, disapprove, or approve with modifications an initial State tax credit allocation.

The Secretary may require that the applicant execute an enforceable agreement related to the construction and rehabilitation of a catalytic revitalization project and issuance of the State tax credit.

If the Department does not recommend approval of a project for an initial State tax credit allocation, the Department shall issue a written notice of rejection with an evaluation and explanation for rejection.

section.heading: Allocation and Calculation of the Credit.

para.text: Upon the approval of an application, the Department shall issue an initial tax credit certificate to the applicant:
Allocating the initial amount of the State tax credit for the project; and
Specifying the terms and conditions of the State tax credit.
Subject to the limitations of §C of this regulation:
An initial State tax credit certificate shall equal 20 percent of the applicant’s estimated new construction costs and rehabilitation costs for the project; and

Upon completion of the project or a phase of the project, a final tax credit certificate shall equal 20 percent of the applicant’s actual new construction costs and rehabilitation costs for the completed phase of the project.

For purposes of calculating the credit authorized under §B of this regulation, the portion of costs that are attributed to new construction costs may not exceed 50 percent of the total costs of the catalytic revitalization project or phase.
A final tax credit certificate may not be issued for more than 20 percent of the project’s eligible expenses to date.
A final tax credit certificate may not be issued that would exceed the aggregated limit of a project’s initial tax credit certificate.

Sixty days before the last day of the taxable year in which a catalytic revitalization project that has been issued an initial State tax credit allocation is completed or a phase of the project is completed, the applicant shall:
Notify the Secretary that the project or project phase has been completed; and
Certify that the project is a catalytic revitalization project eligible for the State tax credit.
The notice and certification to the Secretary shall be in a form prescribed by the Department and contain documentation required by the Department.

Upon final review and verification of the notice and certification, the Secretary shall issue to the applicant a final credit certificate for the project or project phase before or by the last day of the taxable year in which the project or a phase of the project was completed, stating the final State tax credit amount for the project or project phase, not to exceed the aggregated credit amount initially allocated to the project.
The State tax credit is a credit against State income taxes that may be used in accordance with the Act, this chapter, and Tax-General Article, §10-753, Annotated Code of Maryland.

If the State tax credit allowed under this chapter in any taxable year exceeds the total tax otherwise payable by the individual, nonprofit organization, or business entity for that taxable year, the individual, nonprofit organization, or business entity may claim a refund in the amount of the excess.
The credit allowed under this chapter may be allocated among the partners, members, or shareholders of a business entity in any manner agreed to by those persons in writing.

The amount of the tax credit allowed, but not claimed, under this chapter may be transferred, by written instrument, in whole or in part, to any individual, nonprofit organization, or business entity.
For the taxable year of any transfer under §D of this regulation, the transferee may apply the tax credit against the total tax otherwise payable by the transferee in that taxable year.
If the tax credit exceeds the total tax otherwise payable by the transferee in any taxable year, the transferee:
May claim a refund in the amount of the excess;
May carry forward and apply the excess credit for succeeding taxable years until the full amount of the credit is used; or
May transfer the remainder of the tax credit to an individual, a nonprofit organization, or a business entity in accordance with §D of this regulation.
The Department may monitor a project for compliance and require reports from the applicant demonstrating compliance with this chapter, the Act and any agreement with the Department.
The Comptroller or the Secretary may not recapture a State tax credit authorized under this chapter if:

The catalytic revitalization project is transferred, in whole or in part, by fee simple transfer of real property or by transfer of an ownership interest in the entity that owns the project to a new owner; and
The Secretary has issued a final tax credit certificate for the catalytic revitalization project under Regulation .06C of this chapter.

After 30 days of providing written notice to the Department, the original recipient of an initial tax credit issued under this chapter may transfer the initial tax credit certificate to one or more other individuals, nonprofit organization, or business entities.

The transfer of an initial tax credit need not involve a transfer of the catalytic revitalization project, whether by fee simple transfer of real property or a transfer of a portion or all of the ownership interest that the original recipient holds in the entity that owns the real property to a new owner or owners.

An initial tax credit certificate may not be transferred to another person without the express written consent of the original recipient or be transferred as part of the involuntary transfer of the real property ownership interest in an entity that owns the real property without the prior written consent of the original recipient of the certificate and the Secretary.

The Secretary may revoke an initial credit certificate on a finding by the Secretary that the recipient is not in compliance with the initial credit certificate or an agreement with the Department regarding the initial credit certificate.

If the Secretary revokes an initial credit certificate under §F of this regulation, the Secretary may award an initial credit certificate to another applicant, provided that the award does not exceed the amount of the revoked initial credit certificate.

The Secretary may not revoke a tax credit certificate awarded on or before July 1, 2024 unless the individual, nonprofit organization, or business entity that received the tax credit certificate ceases rehabilitation of the catalytic revitalization project for which the tax credit was awarded.
Guidelines and Manuals. The Department may adopt guidelines and manuals related to the administration of this chapter and the Act.
The Department shall ensure that the application forms, guidelines and manuals are publicly available on its website and at its offices.

Delegation of Authority. An action or decision required to be taken or permitted to be made by the Department under the Act, or by the Secretary or the Department under this chapter, may be delegated by the Secretary to an employee of the Department.

section.heading: Waiver.
section.text: The Secretary may waive or vary provisions of this chapter to the extent that the waiver or variance is consistent with the Act and if, in the written determination of the Secretary, the application of a regulation in a specific case or in an emergency situation would be inequitable or contrary to the purposes of the Act.

section.heading: False Statements.
section.text: A person may not knowingly make or cause to be made a false statement or report in any document required to be furnished to the Department or in any agreement relating to the tax credits.

section.heading: Tax Credit Availability.
section.text: Except as provided in Regulation .08 of this chapter, the Secretary may not:

para.text: Accept applications and award an initial credit certificate for more than one catalytic revitalization project within a 2-year period; or
Issue tax credit certificates for credit amounts in the aggregate totaling more than $15,000,000 within a 2-year period.
